channel.title: WHATWG URL Workstream-relevant MDN issues
channel.description: Issue filed on MDN Web Docs related to pages attached to technologies developed by WHATWG URL Workstream

item.title: [url] api.URLSearchParams.delete - Using URLSearchParams.delete method changes the enconding of unrelated search params
item.content:encoded:
What type of issue is this?

Browser bug (a bug with a feature that may impact site compatibility)

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

There should be a warning about the lack of consistency of the method while working with URI Encoded Search Params.

What browsers does this problem apply to, if applicable?

Chromium (Chrome, Edge 79+, Opera, Samsung Internet), Firefox

What did you expect to see?

A section with a example involving the usage of a Encoded URI search param. Such as:

const url = new URL("https://example.com?search=1234&param=my%20param");
console.log(`Query string (before):\t ${url.search}`);
url.searchParams.delete("search");
console.log(`Query string (after):\t ${url.search}`);

Did you test this? If so, how?

You can simply paste it on Firefox/Chromium console and get this output:

Query string (before):	 ?search=1234&param=my%20param
Query string (after):	 ?param=my+param

Can you link to any release notes, bugs, pull requests, or MDN pages related to this?

Couldn't find any

Do you have anything more you want to share?

No response

MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/URLSearchParams/delete

MDN metadata

MDN page report details
  • Query: api.URLSearchParams.delete
  • Report started: 2024-07-17T13:07:48.355Z
